alert.note: Alert for Arthur (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 1:37PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Arthur and northern Keith Counties through 115 PM MDT... At 1236 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Keystone, or 12 miles northeast of Ogallala, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lemoyne, Keystone, Kingsley Dam, Haythorn Lake, Nevens, Broganville and McKeag. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 94 and 120. Highway 92 between mile markers 129 and 138. Interstate 80 in Nebraska near mile marker 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If on or near Lake McConaughy, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
